result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Chaze Hayes #16330-059 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin Chaze Hayes #16330-059 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin Chaze Hayes #16330-059 was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Attorney David Karpe

Defendant Justin Chaze Hayes  #16330-059 appeared telephonically with attorney David Karpe in the courtroom.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentence: $969 fine imposed. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Cash bond applied to fine. Submit DNA sample.  No jail credit. Count 2 dismissed. 15TR6794 & 15TR6795 dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 27, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 2, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

ADA Crystal Long appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared by telephone from Correctional Facility in Florida.  No appearance by Atty Karp.  Defendant states Atty Karp was coming to hearing.  Atty Karpe is now present who just received file from Atty Klopp.  Plea not going forward today.  Speedy trial demand was filed by Atty Klopp.  Atty Karpe moves to dismiss due to age of case.  ADA  Long objects.  Motion denied.   Atty Karpe reviews Volume 6 of State Statutes.   Court ends monetary conditions of bond.  Status Conference 2:30 pm 1-2-18.  Atty Karpe can call in.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Appointed Attorney David Karpe
Letter from defendant inquiring as to status of case
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared in person. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared by phone from Federal Correctional Institution in Marietta FL.  Attorney Klopp motions to have defendant here in person under Chap 976.05 and 976.03.  Argument by Atty Klopp.  Atty Klopp willing to have plea taken by video but must be in person for sentencing.  Atty Klopp requesting detainer to be issued by court.  ADA Long makes argument.  Defendant under cash bond here and offense for which he is in FL prison was after this offense.  Will not issue detainer or warrant.  Atty Klopp wants to resolve matter with a fine for penalty.  Court states since in Federal prison, connection takes longer for video and October 11 would be too soon.  Judge will have staff begin process and contact ADA Long and Atty Klopp once plan is developed.  If that is not possible, will continue via phone.  9:19am recess
Motion hearing on September 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
